posts.name: Brian Andrus
posts.cooked:
When trying to install Nvidia Sync and it asks for my spark login info, I get:

image412×269 6.24 KB

I am able to ssh to the spark and use the web ui after creating a tunnel.
Any suggestions on how to remedy this?

Brian Andrus

posts.name: Elsaco
posts.cooked: One of the fixes suggested in previous posts was to use the IP instead of hostname. See NVIDIA Sync fails to add new host with error "Invalid Argument Host already exists"

link_counts.title: NVIDIA Sync fails to add new host with error "Invalid Argument Host already exists"

posts.name: Brian Andrus
posts.cooked: Yep. I have been using IP address and getting the message.

posts.name: Brian Andrus
posts.cooked: I found that starting Nvidia Sync from a command prompt made it allow the entries. Odd. Now it works as expected.

posts.name: Elsaco
posts.cooked:
When Host already exists error pops-up the easy way to fix it is to delete or edit Host in /home/$USER/.config/NVIDIA/Sync/config/ssh_config

I had this configuration:

elsaco@huston:~/.config/NVIDIA/Sync/config$ cat ssh_config

Host spark
 Hostname spark
 User elsaco
 Port 22
 IdentityFile “/home/elsaco/.config/NVIDIA/Sync/config/nvsync.key”

and after experimenting with Sync working over IPv4 only I got error. It didn’t matter if the IP of DGX Spark was used, the error was persistent. After changing the Host name to sparky to make the entry invalid I was able to add the device again. The current ssh_config looks like this:

elsaco@huston:~/.config/NVIDIA/Sync/config$ cat ssh_config



Host sparky
 Hostname sparky
 User elsaco
 Port 22
 IdentityFile “/home/elsaco/.config/NVIDIA/Sync/config/nvsync.key”

Host spark
 Hostname spark
 User elsaco
 Port 22
 IdentityFile “/home/elsaco/.config/NVIDIA/Sync/config/nvsync.key”

posts.name: Rickeerickson
posts.cooked: Do you have a match condition in your ssh config? NVIDIA Sync fails to add new host with error "Invalid Argument Host already exists" - #5 by sio2boss

link_counts.title: NVIDIA Sync fails to add new host with error "Invalid Argument Host already exists"

posts.name: Aniculescu
posts.cooked:
Hi, please reference our FAQ for how to resolve this issue

DGX Spark / GB10 FAQ DGX Spark / GB10
Initial Setup Q: I am trying to set up my DGX Spark in appliance mode. I am able to connect to the DGX Spark SSID, but it can’t open the webpage it tries to redirect me to (http://spark-xxxx.local). To connect to http://spark-xxxx.local your network needs to be configured to enable communication between devices on the local network/subnet. Windows: Set WiFi network as private: Go to “Settings” > “Network & Internet” > “WiFi” Open the properties of your WiFi network Set the network p…

posts.name: Inman Turbo
posts.cooked: This fixed. I had a match condition for something called platform.sh and removing the entry fixed it for me
